science.headline: How Having Kids Makes Parents Disgust-Proof
science.teaser: All those dirty diapers make it pretty hard to get grossed out about anything else The post How Having Kids Makes Parents Disgust-Proof appeared first on Nautilus .
science.tldr: Upends long-held assumptions about human emotional endurance and sensitivity

science.headline: The Pacific Islanders fighting to save their homes from catastrophe
science.teaser: Some of climate change's sharpest realities are being felt on small island nations, where extreme weather is claiming homes and triggering displacement. Those able to stay are spearheading inventive adaptation techniques in a bid to secure their future
science.tldr: Displaces thousands with catastrophic weather events every year

science.headline: Psychiatry has finally found an objective way to spot mental illness
science.teaser: A decades-long push to identify clear biomarkers for anxiety and depression is at last achieving results
science.tldr: Identifies clear biomarkers for anxiety and depression at last

philosophy.headline: Mini-Heap
philosophy.teaser: New links… The Sorites Paradox isn’t just about concepts, the Problem of the Many isn’t just about objects — and there is an underlying commonality to these two classic puzzles of vagueness, argue Isa Kooiman & Robert van Rooij What caused humans to think of time as a line, and what did thinking of
philosophy.tldr: Reveals a fundamental flaw in logic underlying many philosophical debates

philosophy.headline: Dear Body
philosophy.teaser: by Azadeh Amirsadri For about six years now, since a cancer diagnosis put what really matters in life in perspective, I have finally made peace with myself and especially my body. I have accepted my directness in most situations, even though shyness and false innocence were valued in my adolescence,
philosophy.tldr: Accepts that life's priorities can shift dramatically with a cancer diagnosis

philosophy.headline: 3 Quarks Daily Is Looking For New Columnists, DEADLINE COMING UP
philosophy.teaser: Dear Reader, Here’s your chance to say what you want to the large number of highly educated readers that make up 3QD’s international audience. Several of our regular columnists have had to cut back or even completely quit their columns for 3QD because of other personal and professional commitments a
philosophy.tldr: Applicants are invited to share their unique perspectives with 3QD readers

society.tldr: Challenges ICE's tactics by equipping individuals with protective knowledge
